meanings.sent1: The siblings had a rammy over who gets to use the TV first.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors could hear the rammy happening next door.
meanings.sent3: The rammy between the two friends was so loud that even the pets got scared.
meanings.sent4: The rammy in the school cafeteria sounded like a thunderstorm brewing.
meanings.sent5: The rammy at the town hall meeting echoed through the entire building.

meanings.definition: To engage in a noisy argument or fight.
meanings.sent1: They always rammy about which movie to watch on movie night.
meanings.sent2: Please don't rammy with your siblings over trivial matters.
meanings.sent3: The kids love to rammy over who gets to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued to rammy even as the audience grew tired of their bickering.
meanings.sent5: The two teams rammyed fiercely on the field, each trying to outdo the other.
